SVP, REGIONAL SALES DIRECTOR WEALTH MANAGEMENT
Executive Profile
* Exceptional follow-through abilities and detail oriented; able to plan and foresee strategies from concept to successful completion * Versatile; proven ability to manage multiple projects * Able to build lasting rapport; posses strong interpersonal skills; able to work effectively with individuals on all levels, effective motivator of self and others * Capable speaker and communicator, with refined skills in presentations, education, and client relations building * A resource person, problem solver, trouble shooter and a creative turnaround banker * Self — assured , confident, dependable and responsible in pursuing and closing sales; thrive in challenging situations requiring the ability to learn new skills Associate with an organization that will benefit from my initiatives, capabilities and contributions, ultimately qualifying for advancement and increased decision-making responsibilities:
Core Accomplishments
Developing business within emerging and highly competitive business market; outstanding presentation, leadership qualifications Responsible of managing a team of 24 relationship managers for delivering personalized financial strategies to affluent clientele through banking and borrowing needs, as well as, investments services.
My responsibility and accountability is to manage a team that service a portfolio of affluent households with investable assets of $500, 000 up to $2,000,000 .
The primary objective of this trusted advisor is to grow client assets, retain and acquire new clients through being the single point of contact for all banking needs..
This role will require a holistic delivery of outstanding service and sales solutions to meet clients' financial needs and goals

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

<JD_START>
Job Title: Client Operations Associate

Location: Portland, OR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Strategic Context

Our vision is to be the single reference point for service to families of significant wealth. Our mission is to be the family office that defines exceptional client experience. We seek to provide the most high-touch, objective expertise needed to support and serve the wealth of families and families of wealth.

Our core services to families include Investment Advisory (asset allocation strategy, research, portfolio implementation, and investment reporting), Family Wealth (tax strategy and compliance, estate advisory, risk management, expense management and philanthropic planning and advisory), Capital Advisory (liquidity planning, capital structure advisory, lending and cash management), and Fiduciary (estate settlement, trusteeship and trust). We deliver services to clients primarily through BMO Family Office, LLC, BMO Bank N.A., and BMO Delaware Trust. Together, we have over 130 professionals who service approximately 300 families and manage or advise on approximately $12 billion in assets and administer another $6 billion in assets.

Role Mandate

This role requires a person who is motivated, eager to learn, likes to get things done and has a mentality of ownership. We seek individuals who can identify issues and develop solutions. The associate will have the opportunity to interact with a dynamic and intellectual group of professionals who believes in improving not only the client’s experience, but the employee experience as well.

The Client Operations Team oversees client onboarding, service and administration, coordinates portfolio implementation on a multi-custodial investment platform, and provides alternative investment administration. The associate will learn and assist team members and the functions of the group. In addition, the associate will work with members of the Family Wealth and Investment Advisory teams.

Key Dimensions

Accurately complete appropriate know-your-client account documentation and update systems to reflect current information on client accountsPrioritize and follow up on tasks in a timely fashionOwn certain centralized client service activities and backup on othersOrganize and maintain client filesLog, review and track client service activities


Key Accountabilities

Prepare and/or review various client documentation requirementsSetup, input and monitor client and account information on various custodial platformsInitiate account opening, account maintenance and money movement requestsManage incoming and outgoing documentation (electronic and other) for the teamPerform various client service activities for client facing professionalsCoordinate investment implementation with internal and external business partners and fund companies, as neededProcess trades, wires, capital calls, and distributions etc.Support various compliance and anti-money laundering program requirementsUpload and organize account statements and financial documents


Knowledge And Skills

Two to three years financial services experience, preferably in a client service and/or investment operations roleBachelor’s degree preferredProficient in Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPointKnowledge of financial markets or investments is a plusFamiliarity or experience with investment reporting platforms is a plusAbility to work under tight deadlines and balance/prioritize tasksStrong written and verbal communication skillsIndividual must be able to work independently and in a teamAttention to detail and ability to practically apply written policy and procedures


Working Conditions

Professional office environment


Compensation and Benefits:

$44,000.00 - $82,000.00

Pay Type:

Salaried

The above represents BMO Financial Group’s pay range and type.

Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group’s expected target for the first year in this position.

BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. To view more details of our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.bmo.com/global/en/Total-Rewards

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/us/en

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
